questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Arbitrum ecosystem?

Describe your previous work or plans related to the Arbitrum ecosystem. How does your project strengthen Arbitrum's foundational infrastructure, improve developer efficiency, or accelerate the adoption of novel applications?
questions.explanation:
This project is focused on EVM chains including Arbitrum, and more specifically developer tooling. 

Evmtools currently offers a comprehensive suite of 20+ tools designed to ease the development of web3 apps on EVM chains. Tools like EIP-712 and ERC-191 that standardize the handling and signing of structured data, bit manipulation and transaction decoders to help in debugging. 

Developers can leverage the zk-boilerplate for building privacy-focused dapps. There are many such utilities that further support the developers by offering versatile, user-friendly tools for a variety of smart contract development tasks. Collectively, these tools enable developers to build, test, and debug apps on Arbitrum with greater ease and efficiency.

We have been building for ~2+ years, we started our project as a boilerplate for zkdapps using circom, snarkjs, etc. Since then it has evolved to include more features in respect to the broader evm ecosystem. Our goal is to improve the understanding of evm and make development in web3 easier and secure.

We have already variety of  tools (including boilerplate for zkdapps, and learning resources) in defi, cryptography, zk, uniswap v4 hooks, whitelisting, 
 
(new website - WIP)- https://evmtools.xyz/
(old website) - https://zkblock.app/

Recently, we have also shipped an extension, that allows developers to access the tools during their workflow, “just one click away”:  https://bit.ly/evmtools

We have plans to continue building more tools to help developers, we are currently focussing on tools around Uniswap V4 as we want to be prepared for the V4 launch, it will enable lot of defi app built using v4 hooks.

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project leverages Stylus or Arbitrum Orbit Chains. What unique capabilities or use cases does this enable?
Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within the Arbitrum ecosystem. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation:
heypran: I am creator of evmtools, (initially zkblock), I have been building in space since 2017. I have experience in working on several big projects during my tenure at Big 4s. I have worked for and with companies across the MENA and U.S. region. I had been part of several communities such as zkdao (used to run by Harmony) and mentored web2 and web3 developers. Professionally, I have worked on several web3 projects such as wallets, token sales, NFTs, developer tooling, etc.
I am very active in the community, and took part in several hackathons and won some of them. (POAP collection address available on request). Recently, I have also been in the Uniswap Hooks Incubator, funded by Uniswap Foundation.

evmtools was ranked number 2 as most favorite project on [forage] (https://x.com/foragexyz_/status/1800590010317701261)


[Github](https://github.com/heypran)
[Medium](https://medium.com/@heypran)
[Twitter](https://x.com/heypran)

I have been in the web3 space for a long time,  I have a deep understanding of development challenges and gaps that exist. Given my background and experience, curiosity to learn and build new things, I believe this is a great opportunity for me to get funded build something valuable for others.

data.title: GG23 OSS - Developer Tooling and Libraries

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds
Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation: Evmtools is an evm toolkit that currently offers a comprehensive suite of 18+ tools designed to ease the development of web3 apps on EVM chains. Tools like EIP-712 and ERC-191 that standardize the handling and signing of structured data, bit manipulation and transaction decoders to help in debugging. Developers can leverage the zk-boilerplate for building privacy-focused dapps. There are many such utilities that further support the developers by offering versatile, user-friendly tools for a variety of smart contract development tasks. Collectively, these tools enable developers to build, test, and debug web3 apps with greater ease and efficiency.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
To list some of the specific tools available -  
ENS Record Inspector - Helps in debugging and testing during ens integration
Convertor Tools - Helps in converting between various formats like bigint, gas conversion, hex etc. 
Merkle Tree Generator - Helps in debugging and testing airdrops or whitelisting contract features
Uniswap v4 hooks checker - Helps in understanding which uniswap v4 hooks are enabled for a given contract address and how it is derived
Signature Playground - EIP712- Helps in testing message format with signature types for EIP-712, there are a few templates available default for meta transactions and permit2  
Contracts UI - Given a contract address/abi users can generate UI to interact with the smart contracts in local development, testnet and mainnet. Allow easy filtering of of features and smart contract functions
ABI Encoder - Easy to use abi encoder for the solidity smart contracts  
EVMTools Extension - All the evmtools are accessible directly from the extension, just a click away. Developers need not break their development flow instead they can access all the tools directly from the extension
There are 21+ tools available.
